stories.text:
I think COVID-19 made me germophobe.

Do you bring it and why, or why not?
stories.title: Ask HN: Do you bring your own keyboard/mouse to work?

stories.text:
In the light of the recent announcement of Google Apps closing, I started to look for providers.

I had a look at the typical ones (fastmail, zoho, protonmail) and recall that in a comment, some 2-3 years ago, someone mentioned a German provider rather directed to geeks. If I remember correctly it is ran by a team of people passionate about mail.

Does that ring a bell?
stories.title: Ask HN: German Email Provider for Geeks?
The Internetâ€™s Most Useless Website Is a Well of Deep Wisdom
Gabriel Gonzalez on Dhall: A Programmable Configuration Language

stories.text:
I would like to pay a human to answer calls to my cell phone and just send me an email of who it was and what they wanted.

I don't need a full blown personal assistant, I just hate answering my phone.

I am aware of several call answering services, but all the ones I have found are set up for customers calling businesses, and tend to glitch out when people who know you personally call expecting to get you directly.

Any solutions or am I just being too autistic/eccentric with this?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there a virtual receptionist service for my personal phone?
